ygData.subject: RE: Surviving Guk
ygData.msgSnippet: heh heh, my best guess would be sing em a lullaby, smoke your target, flee! Quickly return and loot the corpse or have a friend hide and loot it while you
ygData.messageBody:
heh heh, my best guess would be sing 'em a lullaby, smoke your target, flee!
Quickly return and loot the corpse or have a friend hide and loot it while
you flee! I have had good luck in Upper Guk using lament and lullaby, but I
just ignore the greens and let em womp me so they don't run then flee! to
the zone and return for looting.

Kitasi of E'ci

-----Original Message-----
From: Llewrend Lynnhaven [mailto:lordartos@...]
Sent: Wednesday, September 01, 1999 12:17 PM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: [eqbards] Surviving Guk


From: Llewrend Lynnhaven <lordartos@...>

I love cazic. Perfect place for a bard if you ask me,
not too much stunning from mobs, it's out doors so you
can use selo's. I gain tons from going there each
time. But I have a problem. I often bank in FP.
Which means I run past guk. Ah, guk, a deathtrap for
bards. Using 70% of our songs in that dungeons will
get you trained faster than standing outside a weight
watchers meeting door when the ice cream truck rolls
by. But I hear voices. "Come to guk" "troll hide
belt in guk" "lots of items you like in guk" "yes, my
precious, the yellow light, it burns my skin". 9
times out of ten I stop in guk on my trips, with
always the same result: me, 20 frogs, and a fear run
to the zone. Why? Why can't I solo one stinking blue
in guk? Why do the frogs hate me so? I just want a
few shiny baubles and I'll be on my way. Our root
even when it works won't stop them, just slow them,
and 2 blues is an even quicker death. At 27 my melee
alone just doesn't cut it, but if I use any damage
songs, it's a parade of kermit's singing "It's not
easy beeing green" followed by a Loading, please
wait...

Please, does anyone have any info that will let me
knock off just one blue in guk? Just one, thats all I
ask.

Llewrend Lynnhaven
(two froglock guards sit in a chair as a bard goes
running past them at full speed followed by half a
dungeon, one says to the other in a souther voice)
"you reckon that er bards dun riled em froggies up?"
"I reckon"
"Ma, git my gun"
